intro: Oeoniella sarcanthoides, commonly known as the scarlet groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oeoniella sarcanthoides is a perennial herb that often forms dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
